page.title: 19Coal Merchants, Ridgewood.
page.content: This{family business}was set up in the mid 1930's. Whilst its primary concern is with coal deliveries, haul- age of animal feedstuffs has become important in recent years. This has been because of the uncertainty of future demand for coal. Some areas have had mains gas installed which now means that there are fewer customers. Before the{coal strike}(1984_85) about{2000 tons}pa came from England & Wales. During the strike coal was im_ ported from{Germany & China;}10 to 15% continues to come from abroad. When the coal arrives it is bagged for delivery. There are 1200{customers within a radius of 16km,4 lorries are used: 1 with a capacity of 4 tons,2 of 8 and 1 of 14 (used for haulage). Six people are employed plus a secretary. Four are drivers,two help with deliv- eries & one works in the yard.
